For he will despise the wisdom of thy words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remove not the ancient landmark;
And enter not into the fields of the fatherless:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For their Redeemer is strong;
He will plead their cause against thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Apply thy heart unto instruction,
And thine ears to the words of knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Withhold not correction from the child;
For if thou beat him with the rod, he will not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou shalt beat him with the rod,
And shalt deliver his soul from Sheol.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, if thy heart be wise,
My heart will be glad, even mine:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yea, my heart will rejoice,
When thy lips speak right things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let not thy heart envy sinners;
But be thou in the fear of Jehovah all the day long:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For surely there is a reward;
And thy hope shall not be cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear thou, my son, and be wise,
And guide thy heart in the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be not among winebibbers,
Among gluttonous eaters of flesh:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the drunkard and the glutton shall come to poverty;
And drowsiness will clothe a man with rags.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hearken unto thy father that begat thee,
And despise not thy mother when she is old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Buy the truth, and sell it not;
Yea, wisdom, and instruction, and understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The father of the righteous will greatly rejoice;
And he that begetteth a wise child will have joy of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let thy father and thy mother be glad,
And let her that bare thee rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, give me thy heart;
And let thine eyes delight in my ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For a harlot is a deep ditch;
And a foreign woman is a narrow pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yea, she lieth in wait as a robber,
And increaseth the treacherous among men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who hath woe? who hath sorrow? who hath contentions?
Who hath complaining? who hath wounds without cause?
Who hath redness of eyes?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They that tarry long at the wine;
They that go to seek out mixed wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look not thou upon the wine when it is red,
When it sparkleth in the cup,
When it goeth down smoothly:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At the last it biteth like a serpent,
And stingeth like an adder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thine eyes shall behold strange things,
And thy heart shall utter perverse things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yea, thou shalt be as he that lieth down in the midst of the sea,
Or as he that lieth upon the top of a mast.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Be not thou envious against evil men;
Neither desire to be with them:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For their heart studieth oppression,
And their lips talk of mischief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Through wisdom is a house builded;
And by understanding it is established;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And by knowledge are the chambers filled
With all precious and pleasant riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise man is strong;
Yea, a man of knowledge increaseth might.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For by wise guidance thou shalt make thy war;
And in the multitude of counsellors there is safety.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wisdom is too high for a fool:
He openeth not his mouth in the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He that deviseth to do evil,
Men shall call him a mischief-maker.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The thought of foolishness is sin;
And the scoffer is an abomination to men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If thou faint in the day of adversity,
Thy strength is small.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver them that are carried away unto death,
And those that are ready to be slain see that thou hold back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If thou sayest, Behold, we knew not this;
Doth not he that weigheth the hearts consider it?
And he that keepeth thy soul, doth not he know it?
And shall not he render to every man according to his work?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, eat thou honey, for it is good;
And the droppings of the honeycomb, which are sweet to thy taste:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Lay not wait, O wicked man, against the habitation of the righteous;
Destroy not his resting-place:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For a righteous man falleth seven times, and riseth up again;
But the wicked are overthrown by calamity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rejoice not when thine enemy falleth,
And let not thy heart be glad when he is overthrown;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lest Jehovah see it, and it displease him,
And he turn away his wrath from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fret not thyself because of evil-doers;
Neither be thou envious at the wicked:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For there shall be no reward to the evil man;
The lamp of the wicked shall be put out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, fear thou Jehovah and the king;
And company not with them that are given to change:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For their calamity shall rise suddenly;
And the destruction from them both, who knoweth it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These also are sayings of the wise.
To have respect of persons in judgment is not good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He that saith unto the wicked, Thou art righteous,
Peoples shall curse him, nations shall abhor him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But to them that rebuke him shall be delight,
And a good blessing shall come upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He kisseth the lips
Who giveth a right answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Be not a witness against thy neighbor without cause;
And deceive not with thy lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Say not, I will do so to him as he hath done to me;
I will render to the man according to his work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I went by the field of the sluggard,
And by the vineyard of the man void of understanding;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And, lo, it was all grown over with thorns,
The face thereof was covered with nettles,
And the stone wall thereof was broken down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I beheld, and considered well;
I saw, and received instruction:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet a little sleep, a little slumber,
A little folding of the hands to sleep;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So shall thy poverty come as a robber,
And thy want as an armed man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These also are proverbs of Solomon, which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah copied out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is the glory of God to conceal a thing;
But the glory of kings is to search out a matter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As the heavens for height, and the earth for depth,
So the heart of kings is unsearchable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take away the dross from the silver,
And there cometh forth a vessel for the refiner:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take away the wicked from before the king,
And his throne shall be established in righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Put not thyself forward in the presence of the king,
And stand not in the place of great men:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For better is it that it be said unto thee, Come up hither,
Than that thou shouldest be put lower in the presence of the prince,
Whom thine eyes have seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Go not forth hastily to strive,
Lest thou know not what to do in the end thereof,
When thy neighbor hath put thee to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Debate thy cause with thy neighbor himself,
And disclose not the secret of another;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lest he that heareth it revile thee,
And thine infamy turn not away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A word fitly spoken
Is like apples of gold in network of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As an ear-ring of gold, and an ornament of fine gold,
So is a wise reprover upon an obedient ear.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
As clouds and wind without rain,
So is he that boasteth himself of his gifts falsely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By long forbearing is a ruler persuaded,
And a soft tongue breaketh the bone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hast thou found honey? eat so much as is sufficient for thee,
Lest thou be filled therewith, and vomit it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let thy foot be seldom in thy neighbor’s house,
Lest he be weary of thee, and hate thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man that beareth false witness against his neighbor
Is a maul, and a sword, and a sharp arrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Confidence in an unfaithful man in time of trouble
Is like a broken tooth, and a foot out of joint.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As one that taketh off a garment in cold weather, and as vinegar upon soda,
So is he that singeth songs to a heavy heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If thine enemy be hungry, give him bread to eat;
And if he be thirsty, give him water to drink:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thou wilt heap coals of fire upon his head,
And Jehovah will reward thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The north wind bringeth forth rain;
So doth a backbiting tongue an angry countenance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is better to dwell in the corner of the housetop,
Than with a contentious woman in a wide house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As cold waters to a thirsty soul,
So is good news from a far country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As a troubled fountain, and a corrupted spring,
So is a righteous man that giveth way before the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is not good to eat much honey;
So for men to search out their own glory is grievous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He whose spirit is without restraint
Is like a city that is broken down and without walls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As snow in summer, and as rain in harvest,
So honor is not seemly for a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As the sparrow in her wandering, as the swallow in her flying,
So the curse that is causeless alighteth not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A whip for the horse, a bridle for the ass,
And a rod for the back of fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Answer not a fool according to his folly,
Lest thou also be like unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Answer a fool according to his folly,
Lest he be wise in his own conceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He that sendeth a message by the hand of a fool
Cutteth off his own feet, and drinketh in damage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The legs of the lame hang loose;
So is a parable in the mouth of fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As one that bindeth a stone in a sling,
So is he that giveth honor to a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As a thorn that goeth up into the hand of a drunkard,
So is a parable in the mouth of fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As an archer that woundeth all,
So is he that hireth a fool and he that hireth them that pass by.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As a dog that returneth to his vomit,
So is a fool that repeateth his folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Seest thou a man wise in his own conceit?
There is more hope of a fool than of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sluggard saith, There is a lion in the way;
A lion is in the streets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As the door turneth upon its hinges,
So doth the sluggard upon his bed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sluggard burieth his hand in the dish;
It wearieth him to bring it again to his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sluggard is wiser in his own conceit
Than seven men that can render a reason.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He that passeth by, and vexeth himself with strife belonging not to him,
Is like one that taketh a dog by the ears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As a madman who casteth firebrands,
Arrows, and death,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So is the man that deceiveth his neighbor,
And saith, Am not I in sport?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For lack of wood the fire goeth out;
And where there is no whisperer, contention ceaseth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As coals are to hot embers, and wood to fire,
So is a contentious man to inflame strife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The words of a whisperer are as dainty morsels,
And they go down into the innermost parts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fervent lips and a wicked heart
Are like an earthen vessel overlaid with silver dross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He that hateth dissembleth with his lips;
But he layeth up deceit within him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When he speaketh fair, believe him not;
For there are seven abominations in his heart:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though his hatred cover itself with guile,
His wickedness shall be openly showed before the assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoso diggeth a pit shall fall therein;
And he that rolleth a stone, it shall return upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A lying tongue hateth those whom it hath wounded;
And a flattering mouth worketh ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Boast not thyself of tomorrow;
For thou knowest not what a day may bring forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let another man praise thee, and not thine own mouth;
A stranger, and not thine own lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A stone is heavy, and the sand weighty;
But a fool’s vexation is heavier than they both.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wrath is cruel, and anger is overwhelming;
But who is able to stand before jealousy?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better is open rebuke
Than love that is hidden.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Faithful are the wounds of a friend;
But the kisses of an enemy are profuse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The full soul loatheth a honeycomb;
But to the hungry soul every bitter thing is sweet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As a bird that wandereth from her nest,
So is a man that wandereth from his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oil and perfume rejoice the heart;
So doth the sweetness of a man’s friend that cometh of hearty counsel.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
My son, be wise, and make my heart glad,
That I may answer him that reproacheth me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A prudent man seeth the evil, and hideth himself;
But the simple pass on, and suffer for it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take his garment that is surety for a stranger;
And hold him in pledge that is surety for a foreign woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He that blesseth his friend with a loud voice, rising early in the morning,
It shall be counted a curse to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A continual dropping in a very rainy day
And a contentious woman are alike:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He that would restrain her restraineth the wind;
And his right hand encountereth oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Iron sharpeneth iron;
So a man sharpeneth the countenance of his friend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoso keepeth the fig-tree shall eat the fruit thereof;
And he that regardeth his master shall be honored.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As in water face answereth to face,
So the heart of man to man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sheol and Abaddon are never satisfied;
And the eyes of man are never satisfied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The refining pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold;
And a man is tried by his praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though thou shouldest bray a fool in a mortar with a pestle along with bruised grain,
Yet will not his foolishness depart from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be thou diligent to know the state of thy flocks,
And look well to thy herds:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For riches are not for ever;
And doth the crown endure unto all generations?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The hay is carried, and the tender grass showeth itself,
And the herbs of the mountains are gathered in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lambs are for thy clothing,
And the goats are the price of the field;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And there will be goats’ milk enough for thy food, for the food of thy household,
And maintenance for thy maidens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked flee when no man pursueth;
But the righteous are bold as a lion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the transgression of a land many are the princes thereof;
But by men of understanding and knowledge the state thereof shall be prolonged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A needy man that oppresseth the poor
Is like a sweeping rain which leaveth no food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They that forsake the law praise the wicked;
But such as keep the law contend with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Evil men understand not justice;
But they that seek Jehovah understand all things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better is the poor that walketh in his integrity,
Than he that is perverse in his ways, though he be rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoso keepeth the law is a wise son;
But he that is a companion of gluttons shameth his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He that augmenteth his substance by interest and increase,
Gathereth it for him that hath pity on the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He that turneth away his ear from hearing the law,
Even his prayer is an abomination.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The rich man is wise in his own conceit;
But the poor that hath understanding searcheth him out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the righteous triumph, there is great glory;
But when the wicked rise, men hide themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He that covereth his transgressions shall not prosper;
But whoso confesseth and forsaketh them shall obtain mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Happy is the man that feareth alway;
But he that hardeneth his heart shall fall into mischief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As a roaring lion, and a ranging bear,
So is a wicked ruler over a poor people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The prince that lacketh understanding is also a great oppressor;
But he that hateth covetousness shall prolong his days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man that is laden with the blood of any person
Shall flee unto the pit; let no man stay him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoso walketh uprightly shall be delivered;
But he that is perverse in his ways shall fall at once.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He that tilleth his land shall have plenty of bread;
But he that followeth after vain persons shall have poverty enough.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A faithful man shall abound with blessings;
But he that maketh haste to be rich shall not be unpunished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To have respect of persons is not good;
Neither that a man should transgress for a piece of bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He that hath an evil eye hasteth after riches,
And knoweth not that want shall come upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He that rebuketh a man shall afterward find more favor
Than he that flattereth with the tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoso robbeth his father or his mother, and saith, It is no transgression,
The same is the companion of a destroyer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He that is of a greedy spirit stirreth up strife;
But he that putteth his trust in Jehovah shall be made fat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He that trusteth in his own heart is a fool;
But whoso walketh wisely, he shall be delivered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He that giveth unto the poor shall not lack;
But he that hideth his eyes shall have many a curse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the wicked rise, men hide themselves;
But when they perish, the righteous increase.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He that being often reproved hardeneth his neck
Shall suddenly be destroyed, and that without remedy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the righteous are increased, the people rejoice;
But when a wicked man beareth rule, the people sigh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoso loveth wisdom rejoiceth his father;
But he that keepeth company with harlots wasteth his substance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The king by justice establisheth the land;
But he that exacteth gifts overthroweth it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man that flattereth his neighbor
Spreadeth a net for his steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the transgression of an evil man there is a snare;
But the righteous doth sing and rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous taketh knowledge of the cause of the poor;
The wicked hath not understanding to know it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Scoffers set a city in a flame;
But wise men turn away wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If a wise man hath a controversy with a foolish man,
Whether he be angry or laugh, there will be no rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The bloodthirsty hate him that is perfect;
And as for the upright, they seek his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A fool uttereth all his anger;
But a wise man keepeth it back and stilleth it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If a ruler hearkeneth to falsehood,
All his servants are wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The poor man and the oppressor meet together;
Jehovah lighteneth the eyes of them both.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The king that faithfully judgeth the poor,
His throne shall be established for ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The rod and reproof give wisdom;
But a child left to himself causeth shame to his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the wicked are increased, transgression increaseth;
But the righteous shall look upon their fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Correct thy son, and he will give thee rest;
Yea, he will give delight unto thy soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where there is no vision, the people cast off restraint;
But he that keepeth the law, happy is he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A servant will not be corrected by words;
For though he understand, he will not give heed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Seest thou a man that is hasty in his words?
There is more hope of a fool than of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He that delicately bringeth up his servant from a child
Shall have him become a son at the last.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An angry man stirreth up strife,
And a wrathful man aboundeth in transgression.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man’s pride shall bring him low;
But he that is of a lowly spirit shall obtain honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoso is partner with a thief hateth his own soul;
He heareth the adjuration and uttereth nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of man bringeth a snare;
But whoso putteth his trust in Jehovah shall be safe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many seek the ruler’s favor;
But a man’s judgment cometh from Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An unjust man is an abomination to the righteous;
And he that is upright in the way is an abomination to the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The words of Agur the son of Jakeh; the oracle.
The man saith unto Ithiel, unto Ithiel and Ucal:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely I am more brutish than any man,
And have not the understanding of a man;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I have not learned wisdom,
Neither have I the knowledge of the Holy One.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who hath ascended up into heaven, and descended?
Who hath gathered the wind in his fists?
Who hath bound the waters in his garment?
Who hath established all the ends of the earth?
What is his name, and what is his son’s name, if thou knowest?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Every word of God is tried:
He is a shield unto them that take refuge in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Add thou not unto his words,
Lest he reprove thee, and thou be found a liar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Two things have I asked of thee;
Deny me them not before I die:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Lest I be full, and deny thee, and say, Who is Jehovah?
Or lest I be poor, and steal,
And use profanely the name of my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Slander not a servant unto his master,
Lest he curse thee, and thou be held guilty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is a generation that curse their father,
And bless not their mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is a generation that are pure in their own eyes,
And yet are not washed from their filthiness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is a generation, oh how lofty are their eyes!
And their eyelids are lifted up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is a generation whose teeth are as swords, and their jaw teeth as knives,
To devour the poor from off the earth, and the needy from among men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The horseleach hath two daughters, crying, Give, give.
There are three things that are never satisfied,
Yea, four that say not, Enough:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The eye that mocketh at his father,
And despiseth to obey his mother,
The ravens of the valley shall pick it out,
And the young eagles shall eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There are three things which are too wonderful for me,
Yea, four which I know not:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For three things the earth doth tremble,
And for four, which it cannot bear:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For a servant when he is king;
And a fool when he is filled with food;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For an odious woman when she is married;
And a handmaid that is heir to her mistress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There are four things which are little upon the earth,
But they are exceeding wise:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The ants are a people not strong,
Yet they provide their food in the summer;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The conies are but a feeble folk,
Yet make they their houses in the rocks;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The locusts have no king,
Yet go they forth all of them by bands;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lizard taketh hold with her hands,
Yet is she in kings’ palaces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There are three things which are stately in their march,
Yea, four which are stately in going:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lion, which is mightiest among beasts,
And turneth not away for any;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The greyhound; the he-goat also;
And the king against whom there is no rising up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If thou hast done foolishly in lifting up thyself,
Or if thou hast thought evil,
Lay thy hand upon thy mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: The words of king Lemuel; the oracle which his mother taught him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What, my son? and what, O son of my womb?
And what, O son of my vows?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give not thy strength unto women,
Nor thy ways to that which destroyeth kings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is not for kings, O Lemuel, it is not for kings to drink wine;
Nor for princes to say, Where is strong drink?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lest they drink, and forget the law,
And pervert the justice due to any that is afflicted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give strong drink unto him that is ready to perish,
And wine unto the bitter in soul:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let him drink, and forget his poverty,
And remember his misery no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Open thy mouth for the dumb,
In the cause of all such as are left desolate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Open thy mouth, judge righteously,
And minister justice to the poor and needy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A worthy woman who can find?
For her price is far above rubies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heart of her husband trusteth in her,
And he shall have no lack of gain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She doeth him good and not evil
All the days of her life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She seeketh wool and flax,
And worketh willingly with her hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She is like the merchant-ships;
She bringeth her bread from afar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She riseth also while it is yet night,
And giveth food to her household,
And their task to her maidens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She considereth a field, and buyeth it;
With the fruit of her hands she planteth a vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She girdeth her loins with strength,
And maketh strong her arms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She perceiveth that her merchandise is profitable;
Her lamp goeth not out by night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She layeth her hands to the distaff,
And her hands hold the spindle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She stretcheth out her hand to the poor;
Yea, she reacheth forth her hands to the needy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She is not afraid of the snow for her household;
For all her household are clothed with scarlet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She maketh for herself carpets of tapestry;
Her clothing is fine linen and purple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her husband is known in the gates,
When he sitteth among the elders of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She maketh linen garments and selleth them,
And delivereth girdles unto the merchant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Strength and dignity are her clothing;
And she laugheth at the time to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She openeth her mouth with wisdom;
And the law of kindness is on her tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She looketh well to the ways of her household,
And eateth not the bread of idleness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her children rise up, and call her blessed;
Her husband also, and he praiseth her, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many daughters have done worthily,
But thou excellest them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Grace is deceitful, and beauty is vain;
But a woman that feareth Jehovah, she shall be praised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give her of the fruit of her hands;
And let her works praise her in the gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator
